review.reviewBody: Living in Georgia, my daughter thinks this is the perfect layer for year round use.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is amazing. It’s so soft and so lightweight.
review.name: So soft !!

review.reviewBody: Color ordered was Canyon which is a very pretty purple brown! I plan on wearing it cooler days here in the west and for a good base layer under warm jackets. I am on the thin side with broad shoulders and the extra small is too contricting so a little more room under my arms/across my back is a plus for me. The medium is TOO large.
review.name: Great top!

review.reviewBody: This is a really nice quality layering piece. It has a bit more heft than the Shade II long sleeve hoodies, but is still light in weight and does not cause over-heating. I use this mainly as a warm-up jacket when going to and from the gym on cold, winter mornings.
review.name: Comfortable and Stylish

review.reviewBody: I love the bamboo quarter zip. It fits great and very comfortable!
review.name: Great Quarter Zip

review.reviewBody: So soft and comfortable. Keeps you warm without being bulky or too much.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I love this top - it feels so soft and looks great! I'm between sizes (M and L) so sized up to L for layering. Probably could have used a M but still looks great!
review.name: New Favorite!

review.reviewBody: I love the style and fit. Goes perfect with jeans or leggings.
review.name: Purchaser/Owner

review.reviewBody: Bought for my morning runs. Light, very soft and comfy, and flattering fit. I haven't wash yet, but it fits a little big, so hopefully it won't shrink up too much when I wash and hang dry.
review.name: So cozy!

review.reviewBody: Love it. Super soft. Fits perfect. Doesn’t cling to me or hang loosely making you look frumpy. This is a great fall and spring long sleeve!!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight and Great fit. Perfect for my needs and keep me dry!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Nice quality pants. I was hoping they would be a good match for the absolutely perfect, tailored fit of my Marmot Precip jacket. Unfortunately, the fit is terrible. They fit more like snow pants. Not rain pants. I’m 5’8” and ordered the short length. My inseam is 30-31”. These pants are at least 3-4” too long. The legs are large enough to wear over multiple layers of of jeans. They may even fit over insulated snow bibs. Maybe I just didn’t know what to expect? They also seem overpriced by about 40%. I’m not sure these baggy pants cost the same as your amazing jackets.
review.name: Quality pants but fit is lacking.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent waterproof pants, kept me dry in heavy rain.
review.name: Eco Pants Waterproof 100%

review.name: Worth it

review.reviewBody: I have long legs and pants fit me well. I would call them long
review.name: Waterproof pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Keeps you dry in rain! Replace if torn it’s cheap!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Needed good rain pants that fit like regular pants and these do. They have 30 inch inseams and fit very well. They fit like my Scree pants that Marmot put a new zipper in at no charge. Great products both.

review.name: Great pants at a great price!

description: Buy the Jetboil Summit Skillet online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Summit Skillet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Jetboil Summit Skillet online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Brought my skillet for an overnight backpacking hike to heat my meal and use as a plate. It's light weight and super easy to clean.  Friends decided to go bougie on their dinner and brought steak along. They were frustrated with their frying pan so they ended up using mine after I was done.  They will definitely end up purchasing a Jetboil Summit Skillet soon.
review.name: Would Highly Recommend!

review.reviewBody: Perfect skillet! Very nice cooking!
review.name: TOP!

review.reviewBody: Nice little frying pan  we have made eggs and pancakes with it so far.
review.name: Nice pan

review.reviewBody: Used this on a recent backpacking trip.  I don't normally fry anything but this time we wanted sausage and ham so we brought it along.  It worked well with my stove and was the right size that I wasn't worried about tipping.  The included spatula worked well and because it's part of the pan I'm less likely to forget it.  Cleanup was a breeze, I'm really liking the coating on this and from what I've read it's fairly safe.  The best part was that I didn't mind the weight in my pack knowing we were going to have some hot, fresh food to go with the mac and cheese and the oatmeal in the morning.
review.name: Great Little Fry Pan!

review.reviewBody: I'll start by saying the pan is very good and the slipperyest thing I've ever encountered, however the included spatula is entirely unacceptable and should honestly be recalled. The first time I used it I noticed it rapidly disintegrating and leaving burned plastic all through my food after only a quick scrape of the pan.
review.name: Good pan, consumable spatula

review.reviewBody: It is a perfect size skillet for one or two people.  Definitely like the non-stick surface.  Like everything Jet Boil, its built to last.
review.name: Perfect Size Skillet

review.reviewBody: I’m in my mid 60’s now, no longer back pack camp, but between hunting, and fishing  back packs, I need a good pan to make my breakfasts and meals. This pan has  everything I need built into it, it’s good at everything, including easy cleanup, and best folding/removable handle ive ever had. To break it in, been using it the last 6 weeks at home, bacon & eggs, flapjacks, or french toast every morning, I think its a keeper.
review.name: Summit skillet

review.reviewBody: Very good product ,price point is extremely high for such a small skillet
review.name: Quality product ,price point is to high !!!!

review.reviewBody: Have used this several times. Light weight, great non stick coating. Makes great camp pancakes and eggs. Soft carry bag keeps the included turner with it all the time.
review.name: Great little skillet

review.reviewBody: This is a nice accessory to have. When you are just tired of the dehydrated food and need to make some scrambled eggs or even seer meat.
review.name: Perfect size skillet

name: Summit Skillet
Summit Skillet

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Lightweight UPF 50+ Long-Sleeve Jersey - Women's
review.reviewBody: I so wanted to love this item, because it is so hard to find a long sleeve, summer weight, UPF 50 jersey. The cut creates too many folds around the chest and shoulder area, and I tried a small and a medium. So disappointing because I really liked the fabric and soft pink color, and I have had such good luck with other Giordana jerseys and bibs in the past. I am 5.5, 118 pounds, 34C. Might work for someone with very narrow shoulders and and smaller bra size. I returned both sizes.
review.name: Poor cut

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Lightweight UPF 50+ Long-Sleeve Jersey - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm a super fan of this long sleeve jersey for spring and fall riding. If the weather is sunny 40s through low 70s, and especially if I'll be riding through variable weather, you'll find me in this jersey. I despise arm warmers, and so appreciate a long sleeve jersey that isn't wintery (so I won't overheat when it warms up). Everything about this feels high end: secure pockets, zippered card pocket, laser cut sleeves, smooth zipper. The fit is PHENOMENAL for me - definitely fitted, but not compressive at all. I'm most often a size 4/small, and the small here fits perfectly. I have the white and often wear it with a lightweight base layer (it is sheer). I pair it with the navy Giordana bib shorts for a pro look.
review.name: Shoulder Season Jersey

name: FR-C Pro Lightweight UPF 50+ Long-Sleeve Jersey - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Code Mips Round Contour Fit Helmet
review.reviewBody: I purchased a different helmet last year and had a lot of ear pain so I returned it. I realized that they sell helmets for round contour fit which based on research should fit my head better. The Code MIPS Round Contour Fit helmet was great I had no ear pain like before wearing the helmet all day while skiing. It also comes with a nice bag to store your helmet and other gear. I would recommend this for anyone who has a round contour fit head. Also, the Backcountry sizing chart is incorrect as it is showing the sizing for standard helmets. Go on the Smith website for accurate round contour fit size chart. I initially ordered a medium based on the Backcountry size chart and had to exchange for a small size once I tried it on and realized the sizing is different for round contour fit helmets.
review.name: Great Helmet for Contour Fit

name: Code Mips Round Contour Fit Helmet

review.reviewBody: I haven’t found a brand of helmets that don’t fit my very average shaped head. Fox, TLD, IXS, Bell, Giro. This brand is no different. I chose a medium on blind faith for my 58 cm noggin despite these other couple of sub par reviews by people with odd shaped heads, mine is spot on. If you have an average head like mine just follow the sizing chart and you’ll probably be happy with the fit, but they do offer different thickness pads to fine tune snugness although not included in the box
review.name: It’s so good!

review.reviewBody: A lot of side to side movement possible as someone else mentioned. Only helmet I ever put on and quickly thought “nope”. It’s like it either sits oddly against the back of my head and correctly in forehead area or vice-versa. Not something I could ever be comfortable in. Unfortunate because it’s relatively light, a good price, and seems well ventilated. Now I get to pay to ship it back…
review.name: Too big and too small

review.reviewBody: Well, as awesome as backcountry is...this is gonna have to go back for the second time. My head measures just a hair over 57cm. A medium in this is supposedly 57-58. I ordered the medium first and it was huge. I could twist the helmet side to side like crazy. But I loved the look and seems well made, so I returned the medium and got the small which is 55-56cm. Got it in, and at first thought it was better. Then gave it the twist test and I can still twist it side to side too much for my liking. I think maybe my head shape just doesn't agree with this. If this fits you, I think you'll really enjoy it. One bummer, it does not come with any extra pads to adjust fit. The search continues.....bummed because this thing looks awesome, and seems to be well made.
review.name: This thing could be awesome.....

review.reviewBody: Fit is tight,  I wasnt even able to get it on my head. Helmet looks awesome though.
review.name: Fits small.

name: Project .23 GF Helmet

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shoe for kids. Secure straps and flat for their feet
review.name: Great climb shoe for kids

review.reviewBody:
This shoes worked ok for my 6-7 y.o. son, but they fall apart very fast. He's gone through 3 pairs in during the last year and the soles on all the pairs delaminate very badly within the first month of use. His foot is finally big enough for adult (women's) shoes and not only is he able to stand on much smaller holds, but I know they will last much longer.

If you need shoes for your kid to go to the gym 1-2 times per month - these are probably perfect and seem to be reasonably comfortable. However, if the kid is more serious about it, I would recommend higher quality shoes.
review.name: poor quality but do the job

name: Reflex Climbing Shoe - Kids'

review.reviewBody: These are the only full finger leather gloves I've liked right off the shelf. Crazy good dexterity. I never feel like I'm going to drop gear and can tie any knot. The durability is a little meh, I got one hole in them pretty quickly but they function so well I'm willing to look past a little hole here and there.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: Easily the best climbing belay gloves I've ever used. These bad boys have full dexterity right out of the box. I can tie knots, handle any gear, tie my shoe laces without any risk of dropping what I'm using. I bought these for a romp up El Cap and they crushed it over the 4 days I was on the climb. With that said I did get one hole but I'm going to chalk that up big wall climbing being brutal on gear. These were worth their weight in gold and I'll be buying another pair.
review.name: Best Belay Gloves Hands Down

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite belay gloves! I take them up on the wall when I'm doing multipitch climbs and also to the sport crag. They are versatile and generally awesome! I did get some holes in them after some usage, so be aware the durability is an issue, but I really haven't found a glove that's both dextrous and durable. Belay gloves put up with some serious abuse, so I'm not really sure what's reasonable to expect.
review.name: Comfortable and Dextrous

review.reviewBody: I don't have big meaty claws but these gloves seem to fit pretty snugly. I wear a medium glove, but sized up to a large and they still felt very tight around my fingers. I planned to use these for wildland firefighting since we are required to use full leather gloves, but one of the fingers ripped open after swamping juniper branches for not even 10 minutes! Incredibly frustrating given the price point. If you are using these for belaying (and have skinny skinny fingers) I'm sure they're great, but don't make the mistake I did and try to repurpose these as a work glove. They cannot hack it.
review.name: Not Durable and fit like skinny jeans for your hands.

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I've been looking for the perfect pair of gloves for doing rope rescue training for Search and Rescue for a while now. The Granite gloves seemed a bit tight when I first got them, but within an hour of using them, they seemed to conform to my hands like an extra layer of skin. I have enough dexterity to tie and untie knots while wearing them and they give me plenty of protection when rappelling.
review.name: Buttery soft once they've broken in

review.reviewBody: I got these to replace a worn out pair of BEAL gloves that I've had for ten years. These have performed great so far. I can move easily between climbing and belaying and ensure I don't trash my hands before a climb! They fit a bit smaller than expected across the palm but are flexible enough to work well for me!
review.name: Awesome Belay Gloves!

review.reviewBody: Used these gloves as general duty/bug protection, x it didn't take long before homes in the finger tips developed. In fact, it was only a month of use. The previous iteration eventually developed holes after 3 years of use. I wouldn't recommend these at this price.
review.name: Great fit, but not very durable

name: Granite Glove

review.reviewBody: I need arch support to NOT have foot pain.  These are great.  One issue I had was that the adjustable strap was too long, as my foot is not "very tall."  When I tightened the adjustable strap, the strap hit the floor/ground.  So, I took them to a shoe repair shop and had the straps shortened by 1 inch.  Now, they are perfect for my feet.
review.name: 5 Stars, but adjustable strap too long for my feet
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you!

review.reviewBody: I still love my sandals, but I have noticed the webbing is gradually becoming thinner.
review.name: Thinning webbing
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: The arch support and feel of these sandals is great.  The toe support is an added plus if you plan on doing lots of walking at a brisk pace.  I now wear sandals all the time at home and outside when it is warm enough.
review.name: Great sandals

review.reviewBody: I love the Chaco Z2 sandals overall.  This pair in particular has a issue though: the big toe loops seem to tighten up after a day of wear.  So I need to loosen the big toe loop almost every time I wear the sandals.
review.name: Great sandals with a small issue.
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback. Most times you can fix the toe tightening by washing your sandals.  Wash on a gentle cycle in cold water with a mild detergent.  (Do not use fabric softener) Let them air dry.  If this does not work for your our ReChaco team can fix them for you, give them a shout at 888-211-9211 Ext 1 M-F 8am-5pm EST.  Hope this helps!

review.reviewBody: I love my chacos and wear them for so many years. The durability is great, outlasting many of my shoes. They are my daily footwear for warm seasons.
review.name: the best
comment: Thank you Andy! We're happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: They're comfortable, but... the adjustments don't hold.  Walking "undoes" the adjustments, and makes the toe loop too tight.
review.name: Not what I was hoping for
comment: We're sorry to hear that! We recommend tossing your sandals in your washing machine on a gentle cycle using a mild detergent and cold/warm water. Then allow them to air dry. This typically removes any film on the straps that makes them slick.

review.reviewBody: Took these on my honeymoon to Mexico and they absolutely destroyed my feet. Every time I put them on I would have to adjust them. The straps wore several blisters on my feet because they wouldn’t stay adjusted correctly. I would not recommend these at all.
review.name: Extremely disappointed with my Chaco’s

review.reviewBody: Love these! Got them for a trip to Hawaii. Extremely comfortable and durable. Did a lot of walking and hiking in them. Hiked the Crouching Lion in them! A little wash in the ocean afterward and they look brand new!
review.name: Awesome shoes!
comment: Thanks Zach! Happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable, adjustable and much more secure than other brands
review.name: A win, again
comment: Thanks for the great feedback!

review.reviewBody: Super comfy. Didn’t really need to break them in. My last pair of chacos were used heavily and lasted 14 years before the soles started to separate.
review.name: Comfy. I bet they last a while
comment: Thank you for the awesome 5-stars!

name: Z/Cloud 2 Sandal - Men's

hasVariant.name: Quad Pro Multi Panel Lantern
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Quad Pro Multi Panel Lantern online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This Coleman lantern is a life saver in a black out or if you are camping. The lights are super bright you can remove a side panel to use to move around with. It had USB charge port for charging your phone. My only complaint is it takes D batteries to work. I wish it had a charging port for the lantern itself as D batteries are expensive and you have to hunt to find them.
review.name: Gives off great light, panels can be removed for personal light !  Only problem requires D batteries

review.reviewBody: Terrible, especially for the price.  If you leave the batteries in they’ll drain from the panels that charge off the D batteries. If you take the batteries out between use, the panels will drain and need to be charged when you put the batteries in. The panels will have to charge up which drains the batteries which puts you at a disadvantage right when you get to the camp site. I have to replace 8x D cell batteries every few months I go camping which is crazy because of the cost of these batteries. If you let it sit for even longer, everything is dead and at this point, nothing will come back on with new batteries. At this point it just collect dust on my shelf.
review.name: Terrible application
comment:
Dear Consumer, 

I'm sorry to hear about your experience with the product. It sounds like there are some significant issues with battery drainage and overall functionality.
We can suggest a investing in rechargeable batteries or alternative power sources such as solar panels could help reduce ongoing costs and improve the reliability of your camping equipment.
Moreover, please feel free to contact us directly so we can further assist you with your concern. You can reach us via our official website or through LiveChat during our operating hours, Monday to Friday, from 9 am to 5 pm Eastern Time.

Wishing you a wonderful day.
Coleman Consumer Care.

review.reviewBody:
Useless for any emergency. It takes 2 hours to charge the side lights with NON-RECHARGEABLE batteries & you can't leave the D batteries in becdause they keep charging the side lights & go dead.
C'mon Coleman, you can do better.
comment:
Dear Consumer, 
We apologize for the inconvenience you've experienced with our product. It sounds like there may be a design flaw with the charging system. We recommend removing the D batteries when not in use to prevent them from draining. Additionally, we'll take your feedback into consideration for future improvements. If you need further assistance, please don't hesitate to contact us directly. Our product specialists will be more than happy to help you.

Wishing you a wonderful day.
Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Disappointing. Not all panels light up when mounted in the base unit. All batteries (8 D-cells and 12 AAA's) drain RAPIDLY when the lantern is not in use. Fully-charged batteries drain to nothing within 2-3 weeks of not being used while in this lantern. I would like to purchase a simpler lantern that hopefully will not drain its batteries when not in use, but reluctant to waste money if unsure which lantern would allow batteries to keep their charge.
comment:
Thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear that the quality and batteries of this lantern didn't meet your expectations. We take quality control very seriously, and we would like to check this further. Your comments are invaluable to us, and we will take them into consideration.

For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

review.reviewBody:
We bought this somewhat pricey lantern after a series of blackouts. The cost of the lantern and the initial battery investment had me thinking that I'd have a great emergency tool at my disposal.

Unfortunately, as other reviews have mentioned, it only takes D cell batteries, which aren't rechargeable. This wouldn't be an issue except for the fact that the 4 mini lights are constantly draining the batteries to recharge.

This means that you need to keep the batteries out of the lantern until it's needed, because if you leave it for a few weeks or months and run into an emergency, all the batteries will be dead.

One of the four lights on ours also had never worked when separated from the base, even with new, fully charged, rechargeable AAA batteries in it. Disappointing in and of itself, but you also cannot purchase replacement mini lights, which is just stupid.

When the lantern is fully functional, it does a great job. Lights are bright and the stands on the beach of the mini lights are very handy. I did a bunch of work in my dark attic, and this lantern was great up there.

But again, this lantern is for very specific short term purposes, and cannot be relied on in an emergency.
review.name: Terrible for emergencies, ok for camping.
comment:
Hello! Thank you for sharing your experience with our Coleman Quad Pro 800L LED Lantern. I'm sorry to hear that even though you like the lantern, you're still having trouble with the battery draining.This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

For further queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

Thank you very much, and have a wonderful day!

review.reviewBody: The lantern slowly drains the D batteries and is useless if stored with batteries.
review.name: defective
comment:
Hello! Thank you for sharing your experience with our Coleman Quad Pro 800L LED Lantern . I'm sorry to hear that the products did not fulfill your expectations due to a problem with the lantern battery, which drains quickly.This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

For further queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.reviewBody: I was drawn to this lantern with advertising suggesting a USB connection... which I interpreted as "lantern recharging via USB connection".  Wrong!  USB connection is to attach a cell phone.  In order to recharge the lantern, you must physically remove the rechargeable batteries (supplied) within each of the four detachable light panels and recharge them in your own separately purchased battery recharging system.  Very archaic and user non-friendly.  8 alkaline batteries (not supplied) need to be inserted into the base of the lantern, but whose purpose I have not yet determined.
review.name: Unimpressive Recharging Routine
comment:
Hi Jasonw,

Thank you for contacting Coleman, The Outdoor Company, and for taking the time to provide a feedback on our Coleman® Quad® Pro 800L LED Lantern. That the lantern didn't live up to your expectations makes us sad. If you had a bad experience using our product, we sincerely apologize. We ardently pursue such customer satisfaction by consistently enhancing our services. We always make sure that customer feedback and concerns are shared as we search for ways to enhance our products and services.

You may also visit the Coleman website if you have any further questions or concerns about your product. By clicking on the question mark logo in the upper right corner, then selecting "contact us," you will be directed to our contact us web form.

Have a great day, and thank you so much!

review.reviewBody: It is a great product!  Bright lighting. And the fact that you can separate it into a set of four individual lights is nice.
review.name: Quad Pro Lantern

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used for home security (during storm electrical outages) and camping.  Liked that each section could be used individually and still emit so much light.
review.name: so useful and versatile

review.reviewBody: Great concept and love the feature set.  I bought this for my family for power outages and hurricanes but I ALWAYS have to keep a spare batteries even though I don’t use the lantern until there is an outage.  The batteries drain just sitting without use.  I have never spent so much money on batteries.  I had even bought one for work and recommended it to another coworker before I knew the batteries drained so quickly without usage.  Such a disappointment.
review.name: Great idea but constantly drains batteries UNUSED!
comment:
Hi Mark2936,

Thank you for posting a review. We are sorry to hear that the battery of your Quad® Pro 800L LED Lantern would drain immediately even without using. We appreciate you sharing your experience with our product. We understand that it was not the quality you expected. We appreciate your feedback. if there is anything that we can assist you please do not hesitate to contact us.

Have a wonderful day and stay safe.

name: Quad Pro Multi Panel Lantern

review.name: Feels very secure and warm

review.reviewBody: Fit's me well and I like it a lot. Easy to tear it down for cleaning too.
review.name: I like it

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. Get up To An Extra 20% OFF discount from: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody:
What good is a spiffy new helmet with all the safety features, if it won't even stay on your head in a crash? The magnetic buckle is the worst. To begin with, its much more difficult to to buckle with your gloves on when you can't look at it, than a normal buckle. The real kicker is that it won't stay buckled....ever. Once its buckled, you can pull on it with all your strength and it won't come off, but if it even gets flicked from the side a little, the magnet releases and it comes apart. So basically anytime you move your head, and the buckle touches your jacket collar, it releases. If I buckle it at the bottom of the lift, it already unbuckled by the time I get to the top. Super sketchy and super uncomfortable having the straps flopping all around. 
Not to mention the venting system, which does vent nicely, broke after the first use (refunded). The lever that opens and closes the vents seems super cheap and just stopped moving any of the vents after the first day of use. 
I'm giving it an additional star because I really like the fit and look of the helmet. I really wanted to love this helmet. Super disappointed. On to the next I guess.
review.name: Won't stay buckled!!

review.reviewBody: This is an excellent helmet. I have had 2 different ones. It is excellent and would recommend it to anyone who has a head which is longer front to back... not completely round or wide... I normally wear a XXL helmet in any other style including Sweet Protection... so if you have a head that is longer front to back than side to side this is your go to... my only criticism is that the BOA system is not well padded in the back... I am completely bald -- so when I dont wear a balaclava or hood the BOA rubs on my neck and chafes... this is probably not a problem for those with hair...
review.name: great helmet for certain head shape

review.reviewBody: I love the cutouts in the earflaps.  No more squashed ears. The magnetic  chin strap is efficient and effective. The vents are  easy to open and close. I find it very comfortable.  I will say, with the vents open, it sounds like (quiet) Alpine yodelers are accompanying me down the hill: a not unpleasant phenomenon.
review.name: Comfortable and stylish

review.reviewBody: The best part about the helmet is the ventilation system. Previous to this helmet, I was using the Oakley Mod 5 MIPS, making me overheat.  My head would be drenched no matter the temperature. The Switcher keeps it nice and cool. Also, have a little more ear space. You might notice a howl from the airflow through the helmet. That's the only the con about the helmet. Also, in comparison to the Oakley helmet, I feel less like a  Pachycephalosaurus.
review.name: Nice Ventalation - Recommend

name: Switcher Mips Helmet

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the Speedgoat 5 trail shoe. I was excited to buy the 6, but it was such a disappointment. I really liked the pattern of the 6. The toe box was so big and bulky and I tripped over my own feet. I returned it and purchased the 5 which I love.
review.name: I did not like this product

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The top of the shoe was made of a strange, unmovable plastic material. It actually hurt the top of my foot to get the shoe off. The tongue of the shoe also gathered up on the top of my foot. This was the oddest pair of HOKA's I have ever tried, and I own a few. The shoe was very light weight and the sole tread was fantastic. If only the top of the shoe was made of a better material. They went back right away.
review.name: Bad Speed goat - Strange Upper Fabric

review.itemreviewed: Speedgoat 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the Speedgoat. I have been wearing them for YEARS! I like having a Gortex pair for the winter, however, every year the Gortex is only offered in black. This is getting a bit boring. Please come up with some other color combinations!
review.name: Can we have another color other than Black?

name: Speedgoat 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: Kazoo Single-Speed Trailercycle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Kazoo Single-Speed Trailercycle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We love this. My 6 year old (who is very tall for age) loves this for when we go on longer rides than she is used to. It does make it more work for me to balance but I would say this is minimal and nothing that feels unsafe. The rack attachment makes a little noise, especially when I hit bumps, but this is minor. She enjoys it and feels like it is a smoother ride than the Burley bee. I installed it myself without too much trouble.
review.name: Great option once children start to ride.

review.reviewBody: We LOVE our Kazoo! It was fairly easy to assemble, and attaching the Kazoo to the moose rack honestly takes 10 seconds and is so simple. My kindergartener and I have been using it to ride to school everyday and it is a game changer. SO much more fun than a regular commute by car. It is the BEST way to start the day and I know we are going to cherish these memories of riding to school together.
review.name: We LOVE our Kazoo! It

review.reviewBody: Arrived quickly. Easy assembly. Quick and solid connection to the rack and stable ride.
review.name: Arrived quickly. Easy assembly. Quick

review.reviewBody: We got this thinking it was a pretty universal attachment- it’s not. It’s for a specific type of bike and it didn’t fit mine or 4 other bikes I tried at the bike shop. Not for me. Returned
review.name: Doesn’t fit my bike

review.reviewBody: My daughter had this bike 25 years ago. We loved it. My niece is 3 & I bought her the same trailer bike. She & her parents love it. Couldn’t be happier. Best gift ever.
review.name: My daughter had this bike

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My kids are 9 and 6, and they love this trailer bike. We sold our cargo bike and now use this instead. My kids love riding on this, they get a kick out of pedaling and pushing me along. I added a fender to the wheel which works great. I may switch the seat post because my kids do not like the seat and it would be nice to have a seat that is easier to adjust. The ability to remove this when we get to school and allow me to finish my commute without it is why we bought this trailer bike. I love how easy it is to connect and disconnect. I also love that I can still use panniers with the trailer bike attached. The only problem with the rack is I have big feet and this rack does not allow me to shift the panniers very far back. So far my feet are not hitting the panniers, so it does work.
review.name: My kids are 9 and

review.reviewBody: What a fun bike!! Our four year old LOVES riding with us. We can go farther than biking separately, and it feels so much safer since he’s right behind us. The design is sturdy, and it’s a quality product that will last with both of our kids. I only wish we had gotten it sooner to enjoy it last summer too!
review.name: Fun bike for an energetic 4 year old

review.reviewBody:
My son loves his new ridealong. He can rage on his balance bike but isn't quite ready for his pedal bike, so this was a great in-between. (He turned 4 today.)

Of note: it was a pain to attach the rack to the bike. It did NOT work on my road bike, so we had to attach it to my husband's touring/road bike, and even then we had to bend the rack's bars to make it work on the bike frame.

In the end, definitely worth the extra effort. I am a little sad I can't tow my son on my own bike, though :(
review.name: Son loves it, but pain to attach rack to bike

review.reviewBody: Great bike. My kid loves it. My wife and I can go for long bike rides and the 5 yr old enjoys riding with us.
review.name: Great bike. My kid loves

review.reviewBody:
On literally our second ride, my 8 year-old somehow managed to slip the chain straight off. On a one-speed I wouldn't have thought this was possible, but no worries. I discovered that in spite of coming straight off, the chain was so tightly set that I'd have to separate it. I'm not exactly new to bike riding myself, so I got out my chain tool to undo one of the links. The moment the chain tool started applying pressure to the pin the top of the link snapped clean off! In ten years of riding that's the first time I've ever seen that happen.

Burley has a reputation for quality, but with a chain this cheap I can't see myself buying from them again.
review.name: Shipped with defective chain

name: Kazoo Single-Speed Trailercycle

review.reviewBody: The Smith Squad S is a great womens goggle especially if you have a small face.Great lens for sunny/partly sunny days on the Mountain. Easy to change lenses, and great color for me. Highly recommend...
review.name: Great Goggle for small womens face

review.reviewBody: Great goggles, fit well on a 11 yr old face + helmet. Love the mirrored lens, easy to see even in cloudy conditions. highly recommend!
review.name: great googles!

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit for narrow face! Looks awesome! No regrets!
review.name: Perfect goggles

review.reviewBody: Fits like a child’s goggle. I’m 140lb and I wear a size small helmet. These goggles are WAY too small. I was able to return them but had to eat the cost on shipping. Smith wouldn’t do an exchange.
review.name: Fits like a Youth Goggle

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my 9year old ski racer and she loves them. Great fit and the clear lens works very well in our often foggy, low-vis conditions.
review.name: Bought these for my 9year

review.reviewBody: These are amazing for someone with a smaller face. I’ve tried multiple pairs of goggles that just didn’t fit. Love being able to swap tie lenses. The clear one is perfect for night skiing.
review.name: These are amazing for someone

review.reviewBody: The strap is to short even when fully extend to fit comfortably around a helmet. This also makes them fit extremely tight. It is challenging to change lenses. I do like the strap design and matching goggle cover. The lens color makes the snow look very flat.
review.name: Smith Goggles

review.reviewBody: I am a 135lb female and I wear a size small helmet. I figured this goggle would be a good fit based on the description. It fits more like a youth goggle. WAY too small. Smith wouldn’t let me exchange it and charged shipping to do the return.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody: Really happy with this purchase! No fogging isssues. Recommend a goggle sock as the lense is big and would scratch easily if left uncovered.
review.name: Great goggles

review.reviewBody: Havent rode with them yet. However, I have a smaller head and these fit great with the small helmet on so far. I would recommend
review.name: So far so good

name: Squad S Goggles

You can use the pole holder with either a fishing rod or umbrella.
The overall quality is good and can not wait to use with my cooler.
review.name: Cooler accessories

review.reviewBody: I am totally equipped for future trips. Everything fit nicely together and I like how I can store the board inside the cooler when it's not in use.
review.name: Nice set!

review.reviewBody: Excellent little essentials pack from RovR, works as expected on their amazing rolling coolers! Love it! My only ask would be that RovR in future product developments extend the height of the cup holder to hold longer bottles/cups (just by an inch or two) so that if you're on rocky terrain living your best life the cup doesn't accidentally get jostled out from an accidentally bump to the cooler. (the bump made the side of the cooler come off the ground a bit and when it slammed down the 1 drink of the two got ejected). Perhaps even some damping material on the backside of the cup holder unit would help absorb any jostling. Just a thought, if you were asking me to be picky haha!
review.name: Absolutely....you guessed it.... Essential!

review.reviewBody: Great products but kind of pricey, cup holder are kind of loose for most cups, but gives you flexibility
review.name: Cool products

review.reviewBody: This rotor is a perfect replacement for the on on my Creo 2 gravel bike.
review.name: Perfect Rotor

review.reviewBody: Quick shipping and well packaged, no noise rotating!
review.name: Excellent rotor

review.reviewBody:
On my DT Swiss 350 hubs, the external lockring (that came with the wheels) wouldn't get tight enough to lock on the disk. This wasn't a problem before with the 6-bolt disks and centerlock adapter that came with the wheels.

I had to use an internal wrench lockring (that usually come with MTB discs) instead and it worked great.  So just keep in mind you might need that lockring with certain hubs.
review.name: You might need a different lockring

review.reviewBody:
I like the rotor - it does what it's supposed to do.  

BUT the packaging is terrible.  Normally, I don't care what packaging is like for bike parts, but a rotor is fragile.  They get bent, contaminated, etc. pretty easily, which is why they're often packaged with some protective wrapping and packaging.  This came in a box with a designed-in hole, doing little to protect the rotor from contaminants or other damage.  Mine came just fine, but if you don't get that lucky, be prepared to have to return or exchange.  

Also, every other rotor manufacturer I've used includes the centerlock fixing bolt with their rotors - be forewarned that SRAM cheaped out there and does not.  I happened to have a spare around, but if you don't, beware.
review.name: Good rotor, bad package, no fixing bolt

review.reviewBody: These rotors are awesome! I have a wheel set with the 6-bolt version, and needed an upgrade on a second wheel set w/ centerlock so I got the same rotors.
review.name: Doing What They Do Best - Just Better

name: Centerline Rounded Rotor - Centerlock

review.reviewBody: I'm always satisfied with the quality of 5ten, I just like how it sticks to my pedals.
review.name: never disappointed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable, nice fit. Very good and grippy sole.
review.name: Good buy

review.reviewBody: I'm a size 8 but they were a bit small fitting.  I have some all leather 510's which hurt my left foot so although these seemed marginally wider I didn't risk it.  Ordered 8 1/2 but not here yet.  The pro in the name led me to believe the uppers would compare to my older 510s but seemed clearly a lower quality.
review.name: Not as Pro as I hoped.

review.reviewBody:
I was skeptical about 510 shoes.  I initially wanted free rider pros but didn't have my size.   Got the impact pros because I read some good reviews.   I'm glad I got the impact pros because the pedals really stick to the shoes and have excellent grip.
Most of all was the stiff sole which I love compared to my previous shoe which was way to flex.   

Alot of people say this shoe is heavy, however I found they were about the same weight as my previous shoe.   
While riding for about 2 hours  I didn't notice the weight and found that I was less fatigued and feet were not sore.  I guess because this shoe had better energy transfer from the pedal due to the stiffer sole.

Very happy with my purchase.  Now I know why so many use 510 mtb shoes.
review.name: Excellent quality, very stiff and excellent power

review.reviewBody: Used 510 years ago when I was consistently riding DH and XC. Took some time off and now back into riding and was glad to see 510 still around. The soles are just as good as I remember and the quality of the sneakers is top notch still.
review.name: Excellent shoes! Quality is top notch!

review.reviewBody: Heel padding broke down after a couple uses. Also the laces snapped not long after.
review.name: Quality has gone downhill since they bought 510

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shoe is very well made and performs very well . It provides excellent protection for your feet . My only issues are one it tends to fit  tight but I was able to mitigate this by using high quality but thinner socks. Also it would be nice to have some bright color choices which unfortunately there are none offered . But otherwise overall an excellent shoe for downhill and enduro mountain biking. For cross country and trail it would be too heavy a shoe . Go with the lighter FiveTen models.
review.name: Excellent for Downhill Mountain Biking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoes they should come with a. Better insole.
review.name: This shoe is rugged.

review.reviewBody: These shoes run very narrow in my opinion. And because of the design of the shoe, there is no room for movement. If you have even a slightly wide foot, I would avoid this shoe. Addtionally the laces are very cheap and the insole offers no support. Good idea, poor excecution.
review.name: Not for wide feet

review.reviewBody: Had to change insoles. Uppers are stiffer than original 5 tens. Harder to break in
review.name: Hope over time they feel better

name: Impact Pro Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Getting the right combination of waterproof, warmth and dexterity is difficult. These gloves hit the first two criteria well, but my hand movement was a little more restricted than I had hoped. For most activities they were fine, but for anything a bit more fiddly, like strapping my crampons on, they were a little too clunky. Overall though, a very good glove and would recommend.
review.name: Getting the right combination of

review.reviewBody:
A well made product but not as effective in keeping fingers warm as hoped.(even after quite a short period)
I suspect that mittens would be a better optiom.
review.name: A well made product but

review.reviewBody: Beautifully made technical glove but I found it very difficult to get my hands into the gloves when my hands were wet and cold. eg in winter when transferring from my first pair of the day. Rab recommends a thin silk liner glove to stop the sticky effect of the liner. Perhaps stitching across the internal layers to keep the inner static might help. Maybe even a thicker fleece inner across the back of the hands on the way in?
review.name: Beautifully made technical glove but

review.reviewBody:
When you’re out traversing powder snowed ridges for hours at a time, plunging your hands deep for a better hold, you do not need to look any further. 
8 hours of of working across ridges, down powdered slopes and more wet rocks I’d like to try and count, exhaustion crept in but no water did. 

My experience has been dry hands everytime, supreme warmth and extremely tough palms. 

These gloves really are the ultimate winter gauntlet.

review.itemreviewed: Candy Gravel XC Lace Mountain Bike Shoe
review.reviewBody:
Spent the past few months in this shoe (paired with some Candy pedals), and they fill a great slot in my lineup.

These have a last shape that will work with most feet from my perspective. Wide toebox and relatively high volume forefoot, and a narrowish heel pocket that has substantial padding to lock your heel down. Absolutely no heel slip walking off the bike.

The sole plate isn't the stiffest, which makes for a really comfortable shoe overall. If you're after the stiffest possible shoe for racing, this isn't the shoe for you. If you're looking for a comfortable shoe that won't let you down with an exploded BOA dial 25 miles from civilization, this should definitely be a front-runner for you.

Rocking these with Candy pedals is seamless, but will work with all the other 2 bolt pedal/cleat options as well.

I wear a 11/11.5 US men's street shoe, 45 Shimano, 46 Lake, 45 Fizik, 45.5 Giro, and the 11 US/46 EU is a perfect fit for me.

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: Excellent Comfortable Gravel Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Candy Gravel XC Lace Mountain Bike Shoe
review.reviewBody:
There is a mild snap when engaged and the shoe does not have any wiggle. There is a good balance between staying clipped in and having to unclip. 

I bought crank brothers candy shoes but they were too thin and didn’t fit my feet. Went with Lake mx177 shoes and it’s a perfect match with these pedals.
review.name: Great Pedal

name: Candy Gravel XC Lace Mountain Bike Shoe

review.reviewBody: I normally run size 10.5 which would be a 45 according to the Shimano size chart. The guy on the help line recommended going up a size. I think the 45 would have been ok but a little snug. I initially thought the 45.5 was a bit big, but the unusual Boa system is really able to make for a good fit over quite a range and as I use these shoes, I appreciate the extra toe room more and more. The printing on the sole makes the cleat positioning more repeatable than most. Like most, a custom foot bed is needed to get the most out of these shoes (I’m using G8s).
review.name: Boa system gives great fit

review.reviewBody:
Once again, I contemplated buying something from STOIC, due to all the reviews I see about weird fitting. 

Lemme tell ya, I now own multiple STOIC products in my typical size, and they all fit great! If you’ve been thinking about it for a while, you should probably just do it. Size up ONCE if you want a bit of a baggier fit.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: They’re so cute and really functional but I would reccomend sizing up as they do fit a little on the smaller side. I’m usually always an 8 and fit the size chart measurements but these fit much tighter on me than expected. The nice thing is that they’re stretchy but if you have hips like me and want a looser fit, definitely size up.
review.name: Size up

description: Buy the Mountain House Chicken & Dumplings online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chicken & Dumplings
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain House Chicken & Dumplings online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely delicious. Restaurant quality taste. I ate this quite a bit during a surgical recovery and it was easy and full of protein.
review.name: Best flavor by far

review.reviewBody: Tastes just like it was homemade but without all the dishes, time, and being in your home kitchen. One of my favorite meals because it's high protein for those long hikes, backpacking trips, or climbing days.
review.name: Tastes like homemade

review.reviewBody: The MH Chicken and Dumplings is very good. The dumplings had a bit of texture to them, which to me was appealing. Good flavors throughout. I highly recommend it!!
review.name: An excellent meal

review.reviewBody: My favorite for both taste and nutritional content. This is the one I buy over and over again and keep a stock in the closet. I just wish in came in a can.
review.name: Favorite, great taste, needs a can size

review.reviewBody: I normally do not write reviews and this is only my opinion. I am truly amazed by the taste. It has become my favorite MH freeze dried I have had. To me it taste like a top end chicken pot pie, which I thoroughly enjoy. I will be adding this to my day bag when I take more long, adventurous Hikes. A solid great tasting, filling lunch that I know will be rewarding to enjoy.
review.name: Chicken & Dumplings, Outstanding!

review.reviewBody: Bought this several months ago and finally had a chance to try it. It was full of flavor and large pieces of veggies. The only thing that kept me from giving it 5 stars was it could have used more meat. I will definitely purchase this again for my hiking trip. Some of it didn't mix or rehydrate well but I actually liked it that way.
review.name: Almost like homemade.

review.reviewBody: Love mountain house chicken and dumpling pouch. I eat it just cause it tastes so good. I'd rather it it then going out to eat. Highly recommend this one I rat it a 10 star
review.name: Best tasting and price

review.reviewBody: With my chronic back pain, there are times that I can't stand up very long to cook a nutritious meal, let alone go  thru the prep. I have an extensive variety of Mountain House meals on hand so my meals are never boring. The Chicken and Dumplings is a very good comfort food that takes me back to my Mom's cooking. It's one of my favorites.
review.name: Comfort food in minutes

review.reviewBody: I enjoy this one the best out of all the flavors I tried.
review.name: A PERSONAL FAV

review.reviewBody: Not as good as my Grandma"s but super close! Very enjoyable and satisfying! AAmazing how good the chicken is!
review.name: Great taste another winner!

name: Chicken & Dumplings

description: Buy the Gregory Zulu 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Zulu 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Zulu 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Beware. This pack no longer comes with a rain fly. I didn't know this when I ordered it, because I have the exact same pack in a different color that I got about a year ago and it had a rainfly. The Zulu pack has ALWAYS come with a rainfly. Now they make you pay way too much for a separate rainfly that no longer even matches the color of the pack. The pack itself is great, but I feel ripped off.
review.name: Bait and Switch...
comment: Like the rest of the world, we are experiencing large increases in materials, labor, and freight costs. When costs increase rapidly, every brand is faced with tough product design and quality decisions. We can tell you with absolute certainty that Gregory will remain 100% committed to maintaining our world-class quality, which will continue to be covered by our Lifetime Guarantee. In order to not compromise on this commitment, we must decide how much to increase prices and what extra features we include in our products to benefit backpackers, hikers, and travelers. No longer offering an included raincover with every pack purchase is a great example. In this case, we have prioritized continuing to deliver a high-quality product, now built with recycled materials, with the most comfortable, adaptable harness and hip belts that we’ve ever built, over the raincover add-on that many hikers already have, or will not need for their adventures. This means our consumers are not required to pay extra for a raincover in every pack they buy and allows us to continue offering other amazing features, enhance the quality of the rest of the pack, and maintain fair prices for everyone.

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this pack for 10 years.  Awesome.  Have taken on multiple trips. Top of Longs Peak and Whitney to the  bottom of the Grand Canyon and Bad Waters. Love it!!!
review.name: My favorite Pack!

review.reviewBody: Overall great item. Brought it on multiple long day hikes and climbs. Great size and comfy

Solid pack! Has held up well across many backpacking trips. Very easy to use and many compartments for different things if you like to stay organized on trail. Would recommend for anything between weekend to 4-5 day trips.
review.name: Solid pack

review.reviewBody: I love my backpack!  Very durable and lightweight.
review.name: Great backpack!

review.reviewBody: Great backpack, stays off my back, holds my stuff, pole holder is great, hip pockets are iPhone14 Max sized. Wish that there was maybe one or two more pockets but overall I'm happy.
review.name: It's great! Exactly What I Wanted

review.reviewBody: Great pack. It worked well for a long day hike.  Had the chest strap break but was replaced without charge. Great customer service
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: Solid bag pack ! Nice for a short 2D1N hiking and I just my red colour zulu
review.name: Gregory, a brand can always trust !

review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: Perfect rain parka. Great coverage, lightweight and breathable. Only request would have been an interior pocket or two. Otherwise perfect.
review.name: Perfect parka

review.reviewBody: I just received it today in time for the atmospheric river. Definitely down size! Perfect weight for me. Can layer with something warmer. Love the style! The hood didn't blow off. The waist can be pulled in. Stylish and practical! I don't like the other colors otherwise I'd buy another one.
review.name: Love it 100%

review.reviewBody: I came across this jacket online and had tp have it. I already have one, but above the knee. This checks all the boxes! I walk 2-3 miles in the morning, and these Pacific Northwest days are wet and chilly. This coat is excellent. I am 5'3" and 125lbs and purchased a medium. It is roomy-just what I wanted. Great for layering other pieces and still have comfortable movement.
review.name: Love this rain parka

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight material, beautiful color, and excellent cut!
review.name: Beautiful rain jacket

review.reviewBody: terrific design /construction especially the hood (stays on). cinch-able! (expands to fit easily over puffcoats etc). plenty long (no wet knees). quiet substantial fabric. zip pockets large-ish (wish it had interior large pockets) uncomplicated wrist elastic (no ratty velcro). terrific price! should last foeva. (thank you tnf for 45+ yrs of hard wearing beauties)
review.name: enjoy one now

review.reviewBody: It was paper thin so I really did not like it. It felt as if i was wearing nothing.
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: I love this coat so much! It truly is 100% waterproof and it looks so cute! I love that you can synch the waist, that it goes way below my knees, and I love the color! I get compliments on it every time I wear it
review.name: 100% I'd buy this again

review.reviewBody: Beautiful style. A little more yellow in person than expected but it's a lovely color. The jacket runs very large. I am a size large per the size chart but the jacket looked visibly huge on me (sleeves too long, shoulders too wide), not in a fashionable oversize way. It's also thinner than expected though it says medium weight. It's more of a wind breaker and rain jacket than a coat for much warmth.
review.name: Great style but thinner than expected!

review.reviewBody: The Midnight Petrol is a gorgeous color. Size down, the shoulders are really wide. Love the length and sleeves are long enough.
review.name: Nice Jacket - Runs Big

review.reviewBody: Not a 5 as it's a bit noisy - technical fabric flapping. But it looks and works great.
review.name: I like it!

review.reviewBody:
The zipper gets stuck at the top because of poorly done inner material. It happens every time, so it's hard to unzip, not to mention doing it during the ride.
It's a bummer, but the fit and general quality are perfect.
review.name: The zipper is stuck at the top

review.reviewBody: Lightweight vest for spring and summer descents. Unfortunately, some fluttering around the arm holes. Castelli almost got it right!
review.name: Almost...

review.reviewBody:
5'8" at 161 lbs. Purchased size M. 
I originally bought a L and exchanged it for a M. 
Happy with the fit. It's perfect snug fit for me. Still goes over my jersey when back pockets is full of stuff.  
It helps cut wind chill and packs up really small.  Great purchase.
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody:
This vest is timeless, beautiful, and has all the right tech specs. However, as usually, Casteli runs small. Very small. Micro small!  I bought it as a gift for my hubby and I am so glad I had him try it on prior to our upcoming mountain biking trip for two weeks. Of course, it was too small, so I immediately re-ordered in the next size up.  Don?t be discouraged by size. Buy what fits and do what you do!
**Follow up: next size up (3x)works like a charm!  Fabulous fit and function. Even endured a crash that resulted in broken ribs without a smidge of damage to the vest.
review.name: Beautiful Vest!

review.reviewBody: My new favorite wind vest.  Super light, folds down so never a reason not to bring it.  I'm usually a Large in Castelli and I bought a L and an XL.  The XL gives me some room to get my hand into my back jersey pockets and I like it better so I kept that one and returned the L.
review.name: Favorite
comment: I'm normally a M in Castelli.  We're about the same size. Just back into cycling after a long time and I'm looking to drop another 10lbs.  I would like a tighter fit.  Did the L allow you to move or was it restricting?  Thanks!

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable but it was too short for me. I am sadly returning. If it was an inch or two longer, this would be one of my favorite shirts.

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I ordered two different shirts from two different outdoor companies, both solar stream Womens. I loved the peach and ice colors! Within one and two weeks both shirts got snags on the fabric, creating pulled horizontal lines with fuzzy string hanging out. 
This was wearing them in just normal living circumstances; no hiking, backpacking, or outdoor vegetation that was roughing up the shirts. 
I am very disappointed. Columbia needs to eliminate this fabric!
review.name: Bad fabric!

review.reviewBody: I always carry it in my trunk since i go to a lot of college soccer games and it’s always helpful. For sure it’s more comfortable than a bench. It’s also easy to carry
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Son ideales para las salidas al campo, muy cómodas y perfectas para guardarse, además de resistente, también las solemos utilizar en nuestro patio en la noche de verano.
review.name: Buena calidad

review.reviewBody: Love this chair! It's comfortable and it's very light to carry around! I like its durability! Love the versatility of using it for camping or in your backyard or taking it to kids games!
review.name: Great chair!

review.reviewBody:
Such a great little chair so comfortable and very stable it’s so easy to pack and unpack it comes with a great carry case and is so versatile a great addition to anybody’s camping experience
￼
review.name: stable  So comfortable and stable

review.reviewBody:
COMFORT: The Coleman Cooler Quad Chair offers excellent comfort with its padded seat and backrest, perfect for extended sitting.  

VERSATILITY: This chair is ideal for camping, tailgating, or backyard gatherings, with a built-in cooler and cup holder adding convenience.  

PORTABILITY: It folds up easily and comes with a carry bag, making it simple to transport and store.  

STABILITY: The sturdy frame and durable materials provide great stability on various surfaces, even when fully loaded.  

DURABILITY: Made with high-quality materials, it withstands frequent use and outdoor conditions without wear and tear.
review.name: The Coleman Cooler Quad Chair combines comfort, du

review.reviewBody: Great chairs! Love that they offer a bag with a shoulder strap to tote around from your car to the beach. It’s got the convenience of a cupholder also and has been holding up well for us for several years. An extra plus is how small they fold up for easy storing.
review.name: Love the convenience of this chair

review.reviewBody: This product is excellent, and the prices are incredibly affordable. It’s one of the best chair you can find. I highly recommend it to everyone.
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: This chore is pretty comfortable even if it has no cushion. Easy to unfold and compact! We have had ours for years and has held up pretty great. Would highly recommend and we only use ours to go to the beach.
review.name: Great chair

review.reviewBody: I have 4 of these chairs. We always go fishing, so they are perfect for that. You have your own cup holder. They are comfortable and last a long time, we've had them for about 2 years now.
review.name: Nice chairs!

review.reviewBody: I am satisfied with this purchase because the chair is light, easy to fold and unfold, and has several useful features (ability to hold drinks and can keep them cool, has an additional pocket). I do think it is comfortable for the price and for this specific build, but I wouldn't exactly call it cozy or well padded. If that were the case, I would give it five stars. But yeah, it is reasonably comfortable!
review.name: besf

name: Cooler Quad Chair

description: Buy the Coleman Peak1 20F Rds Sleeping Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Peak1 20F Rds Sleeping Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Peak1 20F Rds Sleeping Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: 🤨🤨 Have you lost your minds, Uncle Sam has one that costs even less for the same style.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is a great addition to your camping necessities. It is compact, lightweight, and super warm for those colder climates. It fully zips to allow you to block the elements, while still being able to sleep comfortably.
review.name: So warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm an avid camper so I love that I have the best sleeping bag there is. It really does hold its heat without getting too stuffy inside. Top tier comfort and holds it's shape no matter how much I move around (which is a lot!). I especially love how compact it folds down and the quality of the materials down to the zipper. Super lightweight as well. I had my friend try it out as well when we hiked in her neck of the woods in BC Canada. Highly reccommend!
review.name: Best Sleeping Bag there is!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The detail and design quality of this sleeping bag is really impressive.  It’s super lightweight, but also incredibly warm.  I love that the zipper has been designed not to snag, and that the smooth fabric allows you to move without having the sleeping bag drag, twist or bunch while you sleep.  Size-wise, it works well for both me and my husband, and we are 5’5” and 6’2”, respectively.  Details like water resistance, eco-friendly materials, and the interior pocket for keeping your phone and wallet close make me feel this bag was designed for those who love the outdoors, and who love to camp.  This is a high quality, versatile and rugged option for staying warm while traveling light.
review.name: Unbeatable quality and design

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so happy with the PEAK1 20°F Mummy Down Sleeping Bag because first of all it's a high quality product and also this brand is now a new favorite! It's extremely cushy and comfortable and gently hugs the body. I find this to be a real treat when camping outdoors! Overall a fantastic sleeping bag, much better than most and I'm recommending it to all my camping buddies!
review.name: Very comfotable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Under normal circumstances, I am stomach and side sleeper. I was a little concerned about the “sleep-ability” of this PEAK1 20°F Mummy Sleeping Bag. But I actually really like it! I used it for camping and it kept me warm all night. I am never really comfortable when camping... but I was pretty comfortable in this sleeping bag. It seems to be very durable, and I like the water-repellent shell. I like how lightweight it is, which makes it so easy to travel with. I would recommend to anyone who is looking for a first-rate sleeping bag.
review.name: Love This Sleeping Bag!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this for a camping trip a couple
Of minutes ago and I have to say it was great: extremely comfortable, warm and cozy. Exactly what I needed it for, its construction is really nice and sturdy aswell.
review.name: Great for camping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great sleeping bag that is great for most occasions.  This can be used inside, outside, camping, sleepovers, and so much more. I like the thickness of it and it does a great job of keeping me warm. Easy to pull out and easy to put away.  A definite must for those outdoor adventures.
review.name: Durable and great for most weather types.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is an awesome sleeping bag. I love the color and I can’t wait to go camping with it. I love that I can roll it up pretty small. It is so warm and cozy and comfortable and just overall a great sleeping bag. If keeps me nice and want and secure.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Coleman Peak1 20F RDS sleeping bag kept me very warm on our latest camping trip. It’s good for temperatures of 28 degree Fahrenheit. It really is made of top quality materials.  Very nice sleeping bag
review.name: Great sleeping bag

name: Peak1 20F Rds Sleeping Bag

review.reviewBody: Beautiful well made Italian cycling jacket. Not your typical super fitted skin tight road racing jacket.Has some drape in the back to layer underneath. However I think the material is very delicate & thin. I think if I hit the pavement or snagged a branch with it the lovely jacket would be very damaged! Love the purple color!
review.name: Castilli Go Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is a very nice jacket.   However,  please note that it doesn't fit like most Castelli jackets and tops.   Most Castelli jackets and tops are form or race fit.    This jacket is not.   It is more of a relaxed fit.     I ordered my usual size in Castelli tops which was a medium.   The length of the jacket and sleeves were fine.   However, it was too wide in the trunk area,  which would allow cold air there, so  sadly it is going back.  The bordeaux color is quite rich and beautiful.
review.name: Nice Jacket if it fits you

name: Go Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: My 10+ year old Patagonia Down Sweater Hoodie was getting a bit thin and losing its loft so I decided to go a bit thicker for my next jacket but I didn’t want to go too big. The Tamok is the perfect step up in warmth, and shell material. I’m 5’10” and 188#, the Large fit perfectly with room to layer.
review.name: The perfect puffy

review.reviewBody: Great jacket — however, the tech specs should be checked/updated. I have the medium and (fully-dry), it weighs 20.9 oz (not the 12.3 oz currently listed).
review.name: Great down jacket

review.reviewBody: I am a big fan of the product and this jacket did not disappoint.  It was super comfortable and very warm.  I wore it in snowfall and the hood kept me warm and dry.  I very much appreciate the ability to purchase quality products below retail prices.  I will always check Backcountry before purchasing any ski gear!!
review.name: Big fan of the Norrona brand

review.reviewBody: Caveat I haven?t worn this outside of trying it on. This down jacket has an awesome fit, is light weight with great loft. i look forward to using it mainly as a packable warm up coat while backcountry skiing and apres ski. Size medium fit really good for my body measurements.
review.name: Fantastic fit, light weight and snazzy

review.reviewBody: Great value.  I can't tell you how often I wear this jacket.  It hangs by the door and is always ready for action.  Skiing, it shines on the cold days. description: Buy the Natrapel 3.4oz Pump Spray Insect Repellent online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 3.4oz Pump Spray Insect Repellent
hasVariant.description: Buy the Natrapel 3.4oz Pump Spray Insect Repellent online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am an avid hiker so encounter bugs and mosquitos on my daily hikes. I used natrapel and didn’t get bit at all. I highly recommend this repellent compared to other brands.
review.name: Keeps bugs away

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We live in a forested rural area so the bugs get unbearable around here. This product works well, and does not need reapplied.
review.name: works well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so glad to have found a repellent that works great! We love to be outdoors but mosquitoes are a problem. Well, that was until I tried Natrapel! It was easy to apply, it sprayed on easily and I was surprised that there was no heavy or greasy feeling. It protected my family the whole time we were outside. I normally get eaten alive by mosquitoes but after applying this, I was bite free! It works so good. The smell was pleasant as well! I recommend this for staying bite free!
review.name: Very Effective!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like alternatives to extreme chemicals to keep ticks and mosquitos away, but usually they don't work well.  Natrapel worked wonderfully when we were outside and there were a bunch of mosquitos.  I haven't tried it in tick areas, but hope it works as well with them.
review.name: Really works

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We used this tick and insect repellant for an entire weekend down the lake. The pump leaked when you were spraying it and it ran down the bottle which was wasteful. I felt that it was very oily compared to other bug sprays.  The scent was very nice, it didn't leave you coughing or smelling like you were covered in bug spray so it's nice when you want a more discreet insect repellant.  I felt it worked ok.  We weren't covered in bites but I wouldn't use it again due to the mess.
review.name: Oily and pump leaked

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] THIS STUFF WORKS!! Mosquitos will surround me in summer but if I have this stuff on they never bite!!!! In the middle of the woods where it’s super buggy, they just came to say hi and that was it. I’m super happy with this product!
review.name: Great stuff!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This repellent has been amazing. I live in Florida so we get all sorts of ticks and mosquitoes. Which are no fun and at times can make be outside difficult. But using this I did not have mosquitoes bothering me like I normally do. I was able to get the whole family covered and safe when we went out to the parks and the lake. This was a light scent. It was easy to spray and put on and lasted a long time. Only had to once when we first got out. I love it so. Highly recommended!
review.name: Life saver!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is one i like the smell is not over powering has a light pleasant smell and where i live you can not walk outside with getting attacked by bugs i can put this on walk outside and not worry about getting bug bites and it lasts a while i can be out several hours without reapplying this my new go to product
review.name: Bug repellant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product is great!! I would recommend this to everyone to see if it works for you. It doesn’t leave your skin oily or leave any residue on your skin. It also doesn’t have a bad smell.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Now that I have tried Natrapel, I plan to switch from my prior brand. I am a home builder and spend a lot of time outdoors. On top of that, I seem to be a magnet for mosquitoes, ticks and chiggers. I love the fact that Natrapel does not contain DEET, which is not eco-friendly. I have not been bitten by a single bug since I started using Natrapel! The smell is not offensive and I like the liquid spray better than an aerosol. I did notice that there was some leakage at the spray hole, but overall I am a fan of this product.
review.name: Works great for yard work!

name: 3.4oz Pump Spray Insect Repellent

review.reviewBody:
The nicest thing that I can say about these bindings is that they do ride quite nicely. I have a pair of the ion step ons and this combo felt great on the down. Unfortunately that's about it for the "pros" side of things

I have now tried spark, Karakorum and phantom hardboots/bindings for touring. The step ons are by far the worst. While touring on a moderate to long day these things absolutely destroyed my feet. riding in the resort for a whole day I start to feel a little bit of pressure on my pinky toes. Never had any real pain or injury inbounds, just the pressure being just slightly noticeable after a day of riding. This pressure gets massively exasperated while touring. Both my pinky toes looked like raw hamburger meat by the end of the day. Not a size issue, I've been riding burton boots for years and never had any issue with any other boots. For any real kind of day touring these things are unusable.

Next is the weight. Burton wisely decided not to post this on their website. These are WAY heavier than even the heaviest sparks on the market. on top of the weight the step on boots are so stiff that they might as well not have a tour setting on the highback. I have the super light phantoms and the heavy spark surges, and never really care that much about the weight difference between the two. The step ons were heavy enough to actually make a noticeable difference. because of the stiffness there might be a slight side hilling benefit, but it's nothing to write home about, and certainly not on a hard boot level.

Lastly, for some reason they decided to put the riser lever underneath the binding. this made it much more annoying to adjust. it was also very stiff out of the box, and this could improve with use/some grease, but I'd probably have to amputate a toe before these things wore in


I could see these as great for a side country set up but anyone who has toured and tried any other binding will be very disappointed.
review.name: maybe okay for side country

name: Step On Splitboard Binding - 2025
